DOC.brief_summary: The focus study test nurse-led telephone-based palliative care intervention improve delivery care patient newly diagnose lung cancer . The study two site randomize control trial determine efficacy intervention improve patient ' quality life , symptom burden , satisfaction care . Additionally , study test innovative care delivery model improve patient ' access palliative care . The investigator also determine effect intervention patient activation discus treatment preference clinician clinician knowledge patient ' goal care .
DOC.brief_title: Palliative Care Interventions Outpatients Newly Diagnosed With Lung Cancer : Phase II
DOC.detailed_description: Patients meet entry criterion randomize intervention arm , palliative care plus usual care , usual care arm . Patients randomize intervention arm receive usual oncologic care phone call nurse . Outcome measure collect baseline end patient ' primary cancer treatment . The study perform Puget Sound Health Care System Birmingham VA Health Care System . The investigator recruit individual ( n=138 ) lung cancer 2.5 year . The primary objective determine efficacy nurse-led telephone-based palliative intervention improve patient ' quality life , symptom burden , satisfaction care . In addition , use validated instrument , investigator assess effect intervention patient activation discus treatment preference clinician clinician knowledge patient ' goal care . The result study inform future effectiveness/implementation study .
DOC.criteria: Patients diagnose Puget Sound Health Care System Birmingham VA primary diagnosis lung cancer require surgical resection : diagnose within 8 week recruitment must telephone access ability understand English able participate inform consent process Patients eligible participate study include inpatient prior randomization , care palliative care hospice time randomization severe mental health disorder unable speak directly nurse telephone inability provide inform consent
